conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electrostatic force on point charge q between capacitor plates.
Calculate electric field E using E = V/d.
Potential difference V is related to charge Q and capacitance C by V = Q/C.
Substitute V = Q/C into E = V/d to get E = Q/(Cd).
Calculate force F on charge q using F = qE, resulting in F = q(Q/(Cd)) = qQ/(Cd).
Final answer: The magnitude of the electrostatic force is qQ/(Cd).
